tr.td: Additional Act for Improvement of Tillage.

Justices of Peace of Counties wherein Foreign Corn is imported, may in Quarter Sessions determine the Price of middling English Corn, by the Oath of Two Persons qualified, or by other Means, as they shall see fit, and certify the same, with the Oaths, to the chief Officer of the Customs at the Port of Importation, to be hung up in some public Place.
Duty of Stat. 22 Car. II. c. 13. paid according to the Prices contained in such Certificates.
Same Powers to Lord Mayor and Justices of Peace of and in London.

The aforesaid Oaths not to be made by any Person interested, but by some House-keeper of Middlesex or Surrey.
This Act recited, 2 G. II. c. 18. §1.and made more effectual, 5 G. II. c. 12. repealed, 31 G. III.c. 30. §1.

entry.head: Cinners of Cornwall and Debon See Mines.

tr.td: Statute 22 & 23 Car. II. c. 26. for preventing the planting of Tobacco in England, to be in force for 7 Years, &c.

For granting certain Rates and Duties upon, for securing certain Recompenses and Advantages to Persons advancing £1,500,000 towards carrying on the War against France.
The Overplus Duties of this Act applied to the Purposes of 1 G. I. Stat.2. c. 12. See §12. of that Act.
See Ships.
Method of measuring for ascertaining Tonnage.
Duty paid in Coasting Trade only for Goods actually laden on board.

entry.head: Crained Bands See Commission and Warrant Officers in their Majesties Service by Land.

head.key: Cransport Service for the Reduction of Ireland.

tr.td:
Grant of Customs towards Satisfaction of Debts due for.
